content:
HttpServerChannel Class

Definition

Implements a server channel for remote calls that uses the HTTP protocol to transmit messages.

In this Article

public class HttpServerChannel : System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelWithProperties, System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IChannelReceiver, System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IChannelReceiverHook
Inheritance
Object
BaseChannelObjectWithProperties
System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelWithProperties
HttpServerChannel

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)

Remarks

Channels transport messages across remoting boundaries (for example, between computers on application domains). The HttpServerChannel class transports messages using the HTTP protocol.

Channels are used by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure to transport remote calls. When a client makes a call to a remote object, the call is serialized into a message that is sent by a client channel and received by a server channel. It is then deserialized and processed. Any returned values are transmitted by the server channel and received by the client channel.

To perform additional processing of messages on the server-side, you can specify an implementation of the IServerChannelSinkProvider through which all messages processed by the HttpServerChannel are passed.

The HttpServerChannel accepts messages serialized in either binary or SOAP format.

A HttpServerChannel object has associated configuration properties that can be set at run time either in a configuration file (by invoking the static Configure method) or programmatically (by passing a IDictionary collection to the HttpServerChannel constructor). For a list of these configuration properties, see the documentation for HttpServerChannel.

Constructors

HttpServerChannel()

Initializes a new instance of the HttpServerChannel class.

public HttpServerChannel ();

HttpServerChannel(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpServerChannel class that listens on the specified port.

public HttpServerChannel (int port);
port
Int32

The port on which the channel listens.

Remarks

To request that an available port be dynamically assigned, set the port parameter to 0 (zero).

HttpServerChannel(IDictionary,IServerChannelSinkProvider)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpServerChannel class with the specified channel properties and sink.

public HttpServerChannel (System.Collections.IDictionary properties, System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkProvider sinkProvider);
properties
IDictionary

A IDictionary of the channel properties that hold the configuration information for the current channel.

sinkProvider
IServerChannelSinkProvider

The IServerChannelSinkProvider to use with the new instance of the HttpServerChannel.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

A configuration property was incorrectly formatted.

Remarks

For more information about channel configuration properties, see Channel and Formatter Configuration Properties.

If you do not require sink functionality, set the sinkProvider parameter to null.

HttpServerChannel(String,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpServerChannel class with the given name and that listens on the specified port.

public HttpServerChannel (string name, int port);
name
String

The name of the channel.

port
Int32

The port on which the channel listens.

Remarks

This constructor sets the ChannelName property by using the name parameter. If you want to register more than one channel, each channel must have a unique name.

To request that an available port be dynamically assigned, set the port parameter to 0 (zero).

HttpServerChannel(String,Int32,IServerChannelSinkProvider)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpServerChannel class at the specified port with the given name, which listens on the specified port, and uses the specified sink.

public HttpServerChannel (string name, int port, System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkProvider sinkProvider);
name
String

The name of the channel.

port
Int32

The port on which the channel listens.

sinkProvider
IServerChannelSinkProvider

The IServerChannelSinkProvider to be used by the channel.

Remarks

This constructor sets the ChannelName property using the name parameter.

To request that an available port be dynamically assigned, set the port parameter to 0 (zero).

If you do not require sink functionality, set the sinkProvider parameter to null.

Properties

ChannelData

Gets channel-specific data.

public object ChannelData { get; }
Value
Object

A ChannelDataStore instance that contains channel-specific data.

Remarks

Although returned as an instance of System.Object, the value of this property can be cast to an instance of ChannelDataStore describing the channel to which the HttpServerChannel object listens.

ChannelName

Gets the name of the current channel.

public string ChannelName { get; }
Value
String

A String object that contains the name of the channel.

Remarks

Every registered channel has a unique name. This name is used to retrieve a specific channel when calling GetChannel.

ChannelPriority

Gets the priority of the current channel.

public int ChannelPriority { get; }
Value
Int32

An integer that represents the priority assigned to the channel.

Remarks

The priority controls the order in which channel data appears in a ObjRef instance; higher priority channels appear before lower priority channels. Clients try to connect to the server channels in the order that they are listed in the ObjRef instance. The default priority is 1; negative priorities are allowed.

ChannelScheme

Gets the type of listener to hook into (for example, "http").

public string ChannelScheme { get; }
Value
String

The type of listener to hook into.

Remarks

This value is not case-sensitive.

ChannelSinkChain

Gets the channel sink chain that the current channel is using.

public System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSink ChannelSinkChain { get; }
Value
IServerChannelSink

The channel sink chain that the current channel is using.

Item(Object)

Returns the specified channel property.

public override object this[object key] { get; set; }
key
Object

The key of the channel property to retrieve.

Value
Object

A Object that represents the channel property specified by key.

Keys

Gets a ICollection of keys the channel properties are associated with.

public override System.Collections.ICollection Keys { get; }
Value
ICollection

A ICollection of keys the channel properties are associated with.

Remarks

Channel properties are used to configure the channel at run time. For a list of possible channel properties and an example, see [<topic://cpconchannelformatterconfigurationproperties>].

WantsToListen

Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether IChannelReceiverHook wants to be hooked into the outside listener service.

public bool WantsToListen { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

A Boolean value that indicates whether IChannelReceiverHook wants to be hooked into the outside listener service.

Methods

AddHookChannelUri(String)

Adds a URI on which the channel hook must listen.

public void AddHookChannelUri (string channelUri);
channelUri
String

A URI on which the channel hook must listen.

GetChannelUri()

Returns the URI of the current channel.

public string GetChannelUri ();
Returns
String

The URI of the current channel.

GetUrlsForUri(String)

Returns an array of all the URLs for an object with the specified URI, hosted on the current HttpChannel.

public virtual string[] GetUrlsForUri (string objectUri);
objectUri
String

The URI of the object for which URLs are required.

Returns
String[]

An array of the URLs for an object with the specified URI, hosted on the current HttpChannel.

Remarks

The current method is used by GetUrlsForObject.

Parse(String,String)

Extracts the channel URI and the remote well-known object URI from the specified URL.

public string Parse (string url, out string objectURI);
url
String

The URL from which to extract the URIs.

objectURI
String

When this method returns, contains a String that holds the URI of the remote well-known object. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Returns
String

The channel URI.

StartListening(Object)

Instructs the current channel to start listening for requests.

public void StartListening (object data);
data
Object

Should always be null for HttpChannel.

Remarks

It is not necessary to call this method to begin listening on a newly initialized channel.

Use this method to restart listening on a channel after the StopListening method has been called to stop listening on the channel.

If your channel uses a dynamically assigned port number, your port number might change when you restart listening.

StopListening(Object)

Instructs the current channel to stop listening for requests.

public void StopListening (object data);
data
Object

Should always be null for HttpChannel.

Remarks

Use this method to stop listening on a channel. To restart listening, use the StartListening method.

If your channel uses a dynamically assigned port number, your port number might change when you restart listening.
